taxon_name.authority: C. B. Clarke in J. D. Hooker

place_of_publication.publication_title: in J. D. Hooker, Fl. Brit. India

bio:treatment.description: Culms and leaves with non-Kranz anatomy (C3). Inflorescences: spikes; rachilla persistent, wingless. Spikelets borne in digitate clusters (rarely singly) or in umbellate or glomerulate heads; floral scales deciduous, 2-keeled or folded (conduplicate). Flowers: stamens 1–3; stigmas 3. Achenes trigonous, plano-convex, or terete.

verbatim.text: Species ca. 150 (22 in the flora): worldwide.

bio:treatment.discussion: The greatest species diversity of Cyperus subg. Pycnostachys is found in the lowland forests of Central America, South America, Africa, and Malesia.

references.reference: Carter, J. R., D. K. Alexander, C. T. Bryson, and A. Lazari. 1999. The taxonomy of Cyperus virens and Cyperus drummondii (Cyperaceae) in the southeastern United States. Sida 18: 1049–1063.
